name: Mediterranean Quinoa Power Bowl
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted and halved
steps:
Rinse quinoa thoroughly and cook in vegetable broth according to package instructions (about 15-20 minutes).
Once cooked, fluff with a fork and spread on a baking sheet to cool to room temperature.
While quinoa cools, prepare all vegetables: halve tomatoes, dice cucumber and bell pepper, slice red onion.
Drain and rinse chickpeas thoroughly.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, minced garlic, sumac (if using), salt, and pepper to create the dressing.
Transfer cooled quinoa to a large mixing bowl.
Add chickpeas, olives, tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, and red onion to the quinoa.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently until everything is well coated.
Add crumbled feta cheese and fresh herbs (parsley and oregano).
Toss once more and adjust seasoning if needed.
Let the bowl sit for 10-15 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled. Can be stored in refrigerator for up to 3 days.
